channel.title: sillygwailo tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from sillygwailo.

item.description:
I got a preview of this when walking past a Shoppers Drug Mart. They listed COVID-19 along with other diseases, like shingles and hepatitis A and B, that people should get up-to-date on their vaccines for. https://t.co/TxNy2Hh5V9
https://t.co/nHHlZRXVTA
This has implications for @fullyjabbedCA, which I will be retiring soon.
Who else but Andre Burakovsky?
@rcousine You‚Äôre welcome. Also, thank you for inviting me over when you make them.
@rcousine https://t.co/bFbmwkXkPN
@CimberFan Cimber gets the W! As he would say, LET‚ÄôS GOOOO!
Ryan Mountcastle is ridiculous.
The view from the hotel in Victoria. https://t.co/6JdlrbbpF7
Who do I know, or who knows me, that‚Äôll be in Toronto for #CollisionConf next week? I‚Äôll be in town too!
I‚Äôm going to let someone else point out that, when sending to an email list about digital privacy, the maintainer forgot to BCC everybody.

@kevinmarks @coinbase Cosmo: Posit: People think a bank might be financially shaky. Martin: Consequence: People start to withdraw their money. Cosmo: Result: Pretty soon it *is* financially shaky. https://t.co/RQXjtUArJH
@kevinmarks Done.
Life milestone: I have power of attorney now.

Good. https://t.co/0kkathBQJ6
‚ÄúAll that happens on the 25-year anniversary date of these murders is that the offender can ask the parole board to consider releasing him on parole.‚Äù Does that mean he‚Äôs eligible for parole 21 years from now? https://t.co/iFozo2Fxxh
(The chances of it happening are essentially zero. I just want to put a date in my calendar.)
This is funny not least because the headline makes it sound like officials not only know which specific beaver did it, but are withholding its name from the public. https://t.co/1a6iv338WG
I visited the plaque honouring my late mother today. https://t.co/lZ0Lc7O6Zt
HYFR. https://t.co/6KzdwXXNZY
Just when I leave town does Toronto‚Äôs Department of Sunsets come out with some of its best work. https://t.co/g4FddjgzzC
@johnnypolitic @Wilnerness It is now.
@jeffjedras Thanks! This one‚Äôs a short one, for a joyous occasion. I‚Äôve been looking forward to this for some time.

YYZ ‚úàÔ∏è YVR ‚úàÔ∏è YQQ
Security at D gates was a breeze. I‚Äôm still good with arriving 3 hours early (and not the recommended 2). I‚Äôm glad I held myself back from arriving 4 hours early.
An hour delay,with the plane stuck at the gate. It‚Äôs hard to get mad when there‚Äôs so much to do (read a book, watch a movie, try to catch the eye of the ground crew and wave at them).
I‚Äôm in the air now. Long flights are where I try to make a decision or two, deciding being the thing I hate doing the most.
I decided a bunch of small things on the flight, mostly consisting of changing ‚Äúwrite/think about‚Äù to ‚Äúdo one thing towards‚Äù in my repeating reminders. Something something cabin pressure makes you think if not better, then at least differently something something.
I usually regret telling European people, well, anything.
@toddsieling I mean, well. https://t.co/83eUEJMEkU

Tonight. https://t.co/Qt5tiAREUz
I‚Äôm a longtime admire of Edward Burtynksy‚Äôs work, and seeing it on Yonge-Dundas Square‚Äôs giant screens with an immersive sound experience was pretty incredible. https://t.co/lCCsyVp4qF
If you missed it tonight, you can see it again tomorrow night. Plan on finding something else to do downtown as well, since it‚Äôs a short show.
If you couldn‚Äôt make the world premiere of In the Wake of Progress by Edward Burtynsky in Toronto‚Äôs Yonge-Dundas square, he has collected a number of tweets about it (including video) in a Twitter Moment: https://t.co/PmaiNIyxoi

Tonight. https://t.co/jrtgu2GrYQ
Of course, I‚Äôm not the only member of @ICCTtweets attending the concert. I ran into 4 of them, almost all at once.
Everybody remembers the first time they saw a guitarist sing into their guitar‚Äôs pickups, I assume. ü§Ø
It could be that J√≥nsi did it when I saw Sigur R√≥s at Echo Beach in 2017, but I might not have noticed until tonight‚Äôs performance.
Same, except Toronto. https://t.co/LW9dVu9tqj
The music of Sigur R√≥s reminds me that I, too, must die.
This afternoon. https://t.co/2dZbWNFyLX
